intro: Jasione orbiculata f. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy orbiculate Jasione, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, rounded leaves and small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Native to southern Europe, this plant thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. The hairy texture of its foliage is a distinguishing feature, providing it with some degree of drought tolerance. It is a perennial species, often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
